Este indicador no lo podemos contestar debido a la falta de información consolidada. El fortalecimiento de los sistemas de información se han visto diezmados por las dificultades que acarrea la pandemia de COVID-19. Para construir este dato deberíamos cruzar de fuentes, por un lado la base del Instituto Nacional de Enfermedades Respiratorias (INER) “Dr. Emilio Coni" casos nuevos de TB-VIH y El registro de notificaciones del SNVS 2.0 para el total de casos de VIH.
La información que contamos el indicador quedaría así: 

Número total de personas con VIH con tuberculosis (TB) activa, expresado como el porcentaje de los pacientes que se incluyen por primera vez en el tratamiento para el VIH durante el periodo de notificación = 19,8%		
Número total de personas con VIH recién incluidas en tratamiento para el VIH y con TB activa durante el periodo de notificación = 467*	
Número total de personas que se incluyeron por primera vez en tratamiento frente al VIH (es decir los que se registra

De plus, ceci correspondrait à un taux de coinfection tuberculose/VIH de 100%. Ce qui est impossible.

remarks.tbcases: (I) The national nominal database was reviewed case by base to clean duplicates and other registration or dataclerk errors.  (ii) of the 61 initial rapid tests done, 41 were LF-LAM and 20 Xpert
remarks.mdr.patients: One (1) case was started MDR treatment but unconfirmed (extrapulmonary TB). All MDR patients were started on short-injectable (Bangladesh). Bedaquiline was NOT in RR/MDR initial regimens but it was used to replace injectable in 2 cases. The four cases preXDR cases started on individualized, BDQ-LZD based regimens. The country does not have DST for new drugs.
remarks.dr.surveillance: Despite a survey published in 2016 (ERJ), and yearly proportions of RR among of new TB cases remaining constantly over 8%, RR proportion in WHO global reports for EQG remains lower. RR cases in the survey were confirmed (including WGS) and about 80% RR cases diagnosed 2017-2019 were sent for confirmation to a Reference Lab. 2020 because of covid didnt see confirmation of cases, but RR was diagnosed with ULTRA version (different to the study in Rwanda) and results with 'very low' were repeated
remarks.hiv.patients: The gap between HIV+ and ART initiation seem to be due to underreporting (missing records) of ART initiation, but this couldnt be definitely ascertained hence the data is kept as recorded.

hiv.tbrx.art.remarks:
METODOLOGÍA:
Para la construcción del numerador del indicador se utilizó la base de datos de Coinfección VIH-TB con datos nominales de las 16 Unidades de Atención Integral del MSPAS. En la base se registran todos los pacientes con Tuberculosis que tiene identificados el Programa de Tuberculosis, se utiliza la variable de "VIH" para seleccionar aquellos pacientes con la opción "R" que significa que son positivos confirmado de VIH. Para identificar si reciben terapia combinada, se selección la opción "Si" de la variable de "TARV". 

No hay datos para poder desagregar el indicador por ciudad, esto debido a que los instrumentos no recolectan información de la ciudad de residencia de las personas actualmente.

Se utiliza el dato consensuado junto el Programa de Tuberculosis.
hiv.tbdetect.hiv.reg.new2.remarks:
METODOLOGÍA:
Para la construcción del numerador del indicador se utilizó la base de datos de Coinfección VIH-TB con datos nominales de las 16 Unidades de Atención Integral del MSPAS. En la base se registran todos los pacientes con Tuberculosis que tiene identificados el Programa de Tuberculosis, se utiliza la variable de "VIH" para seleccionar a aquellos pacientes con la opción "R" que significa que son positivos confirmado de VIH. Para identificar si reciben tratamiento antirretroviral, se selección la opción "Si" de la variable de "TARV". Finalmente para identificar que son nuevos, se selecciona de la variable de "Fecha de VIH" el año 2020. 

Para la construcción del denominador se utilizó el número de personas consolidado de la sumatoria de lo reportado en el Anexo D "Consolidado mensual de personas recibiendo terapia antirretroviral" del cuadro de "IV. PACIENTES CON VIH DE NUEVO INGRESO A LA UAI EN TAR EN EL MES DEL REPORTE" y del Anexo F del cuadro de "IX. PACIENTES CON VIH DE
hiv.tpt.eligible.start.remarks:
METODOLOGÍA (Recién matriculados en la atención del VIH):
Para la construcción del numerador del indicador de personas recién inscritas en servicios de VIH con TAR que iniciaron tratamiento para la infección por tuberculosis latente; se utilizo el número consolidado de personas reportadas en la matriz "atención integral de VIH" del  
del cuadro: "De las personas nuevas VIH+  en la cohorte con tratamiento en Atención Integral que fueron nuevos diagnósticos de VIH en el año 2020, ¿cuántas iniciaron profilaxis con Isoniazida durante el año 2020?"; solicitado a las 19 Unidades de Atención Integral.

Las Unidades de Atención Integral de: Elisa Martínez, Sanidad Militar, Hospicio San José e IGSS no reportaron a ningún paciente registrado por primera vez en la atención para el VIH con TAR que haya iniciado tratamiento para la infección por tuberculosis latente durante el periodo de notificación.

Para la construcción del denominador se utilizó el número de personas consolidado de la su

remarks.tbcases: All the above mentioned data are just compiling drug-susceptible and drug-resistant notified cases from respective patient registers. Overlapping cases between these two registers cannot be excluded without establishing One comprehensive data base system inclusive of both DS- and DR-TB cases.   According to previous year practice, late submitted cases would be occasionally occured while on annual data validation, but it cannot be happened due to the current political unrest since February 2021.
remarks.mdr.patients: 2.15 BMUs in NTP network cannot provide this data. Instead, it was previously provided by NTRL and other culture laboratories. Unfortunately, for this reporting period, because of current political instability, NTRL data could only be provided. Additional FQ resistant cases whose have already been registered as RR/MDR-TB cannot be excluded.

2.30-2.37 Although BMUs cannot provide these data, lab.(NTRL only) data is submitted as proxy data. According to current NTP guidelines, because of limited resources, FL-LPA testing is only conducted among sputum smear still positive cases at the end of intensive phase (non-converter) who are also not positive results by GeneXpert.

hiv.tbrx.art.remarks:
This data is from NCID HIV Programme Database which only accounts for HIV diagnosed patients of age 15 and above presenting at the National Centre for Infectious Diseases (NCID) and Tan Tock Seng Hospital (TTSH) Infectious Diseases clinics, which covers about 60-70% of HIV cases in Singapore. The data does not cover patients seen at other healthcare institutions. 

RECRUITMENT/SCREENING CRITERIA
1. Only patients who have clinic visit to NCID/TTSH Infectious Diseases starting from 2006 onwards; 
2. HIV-positive patients 
3. At least one time outpatient clinic visit
*Note: Added the list of new foreigners cases starting from January 2017 onwards 

EXCLUSION CRITERIA 
- Only inpatient cases 
- GRT/Eye referral patients from other hospitals
- Foreigners whose first clinic visit earlier than 2017
The data is provided by NCID and TTSH Infectious Diseases only, which covers about 60-70% of HIV cases in Singapore. 

The data does not cover patients seen at other healthcare insti

This data is from NCID HIV Programme Database which only accounts for HIV diagnosed patients of age 15 and above presenting at the National Centre for Infectious Diseases (NCID) and Tan Tock Seng Hospital (TTSH) Infectious Diseases clinics, which covers about 60-70% of HIV cases in Singapore. 
The data does not cover patients seen at other healthcare institutions. 

RECRUITMENT/SCREENING CRITERIA
1. Only patients who have clinic visit to NCID/TTSH Infectious Diseases starting from 2006 onwards; 
2. HIV-positive patients 
3. At least one time outpatient clinic visit
*Note: Added the list of new foreigners cases starting from January 2017 onwards 

EXCLUSION CRITERIA 
- Only inpatient cases 
- GRT/Eye referral patients from other hospitals
- Foreigners whose first clinic visit earlier than 2017
The data is provided by NCID and TTSH Infectious Diseases only, which covers about 60-70% of HIV cases in Singapore. 

The data does not cover patients seen at other healthcare ins

remarks.hiv.patients: National HIV surveillance program data reflects the detected HIV/TB cases at the time of the first HIV diagnosis. National HIV surveillance does not include follow up information, it means that there is no data for the patients who have been diagnosed with HIV before 2020 and have been diagnosed with TB in 2020.Therefore National HIV surveillance data is less than the number we have given in 2.46. Our data presented here show all cases of TB/HIV co infection in the 2020 TB patient cohort.

remarks.mdr.patients: The RR/MDR-TB detection declined by 26% as it was in 2019. This is due to shortage of GeneXpert cartridges as a results of delay in delivery.

hiv.tpt.eligible.start.remarks: Data is collected through annual form 58 (Nominator - 11 425 people) and form 2 (Denominator - 15 707 people including registered foreigners and excluding children at the stage of confirmation of HIV infection). Data do not include information from Crimea, Sevastopol, and NGCA of Luhansk and Donetsk regions (Data are not available). Partially underperformance of the indicator on the coverage of TPT associated with objective reasons for the large burden of TB among people who are living with HIV in Ukraine, when among the number of people first taken under medical supervision during 2020, 12.9% had active TB and started TB treatment, that is, did not need TPT. Also, partially underperformance of the indicator for the coverage of TPT is associated with the complexity and duration of the process of active TB confirmation in newly identified PHLW. In these cases, TPT is delayed until the final completion of the diagnostic process and the exclusion of active TB. It should be noted that the

hiv.tbdetect.hiv.reg.new2.remarks: The country does not currently track PLHIV with active TB among those that are newly enrolled in HIV treatment, but rather reports TB patients testing positive to HIV started on ART. As such, the data (numerator) provided in the report is from the cases that were notified in 2020, while the denominator is from the HIV program (newly enrolled in HIV care). This is used as a proxy, as the country does not currently track active TB in the HIV population.

remarks.tbcases: Among the cases reported in questions 2.1 – 2.4, total number of TB cases reported among foreign-born individuals (or among non-citizens if that is the criterion used in your country): The programme does not collect data for this indicator
remarks.hiv.patients: The number recorded as HIV positive was 8394 in UNAIDS AIDS Programme report while in TB report was 8397. The difference of 3 was due to update of the DHIS2.3 system. Among HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients reported, the number started or continued on antiretroviral therapy (ART) is 7844 according to the DHIS2. The same figure was provided to the NAC for their global report and the difference is due to wrong data entered into the GAM report and NAC will update the GAM
